list.title: AudioTrack

list.title: Chapter
list.description: Represents a chapter of media content.

list.title: ComposedSrcMediaData
list.description: Represents the result of composing source media data.

list.title: Credit
list.description: Represents credit information.

list.title: DataProvider
list.description: Creates an instance of DataProvider.

list.title: DataProvider#handleRequest
list.description:
Handles requests by constructing URLs and fetching data.

This provides unified error handling, regardless of the urlHandler used.

list.title: DataProvider#mediaCompositionUrlHandler
list.description: Gets the media composition URL by URN.

list.title: DataProvider#setIlHost
list.description: Sets the integration layer host name.

list.description: Represents Digital Rights Management (DRM) information associated with a media resource.

list.description: Represents an episode of media content.

list.title: HbbtvProperties
list.description: Represents HbbTV properties associated with a chapter.

list.title: Headline
list.description: Represents headline information.

list.title: KeySystems
list.description: Represents the result of building key systems.

list.title: KeySystems#keySystems
list.description: A mapping of DRM types to their corresponding key systems information. For "FAIRPLAY" type, it includes a structure with certificate and license URIs; for other types, it's a string representing the license URL.

list.title: Language
list.description: Represents a language.

list.title: Link
list.description: Represents a link.

list.title: MainResource
list.description: Represents the transformed format of a resource.

list.title: MainResource#analyticsData
list.description: Merged analytics data.

list.title: MainResource#analyticsMetadata
list.description: Merged analytics metadata.

list.title: MainResource#blockReason
list.description: Block reason from the main chapter.

list.title: MainResource#blockedSegments
list.description: Blocked segments from the main chapter.

list.title: MainResource#chapters
list.description: Chapters from the main chapter.

list.title: MainResource#drmList
list.description: List of DRM information from the resource.

list.title: MainResource#dvr
list.description: DVR information from the resource.

list.title: MainResource#eventData
list.description: Event data from the main chapter.

list.title: MainResource#id
list.description: ID from the main chapter.

list.title: MainResource#imageCopyright
list.description: The url of the copyright image copyright from the main chapter.

list.title: MainResource#imageUrl
list.description: The url of the image from the main chapter.

list.title: MainResource#intervals
list.description: Time intervals from the main chapter.

list.title: MainResource#live
list.description: Live status from the resource.

list.title: MainResource#mediaType
list.description: Media type from the main chapter.

list.title: MainResource#mimeType
list.description: MIME type from the resource.

list.title: MainResource#presentation
list.description: Presentation information from the resource.

list.title: MainResource#quality
list.description: Quality information from the resource.

list.title: MainResource#streamOffset
list.description: Stream offset from the resource.

list.title: MainResource#streaming
list.description: Streaming information from the resource.

list.title: MainResource#subtitles
list.description: Filtered external subtitles.

list.title: MainResource#title
list.description: The title of this resource.

list.title: MainResource#tokenType
list.description: Token type from the resource.

list.title: MainResource#url
list.description: URL from the resource.

list.title: MainResource#urn
list.description: Chapter URN.

list.title: MainResource#vendor
list.description: Vendor from the main chapter.

list.title: MainResourceWithKeySystems
list.description: A {@link MainResource} that can contain {@link KeySystems} information.

list.title: MediaComposition
list.description: Represents the composition of media content.

list.title: MediaComposition#findChapterByUrn
list.description: Find a chapter by its URN.

list.title: MediaComposition#findMainSegment
list.description: Return a segment from main chapter following segmentUrn in mediaComposition.

list.title: MediaComposition#findResourceListByUrn
list.description: Find resource list by URN.

list.title: MediaComposition#getChapters
list.description: A list of chapters.

list.title: MediaComposition#getFilteredExternalSubtitles
list.description:
Filter external text tracks that are already available internally.

Rules:

  1. TTML format is filtered

  2. If both are empty that means only internal text tracks will be displayed to the user as they are automatically loaded by the player.

  3. If subtitleInformationList is missing from the MediaComposition and subtitleList is available but the media contains internal text tracks that are also available internally. It will result on a duplication client side.

  4. If subtitleList and subtitleInformationList a merge between both will be operated, removing the external text tracks already available internally.

list.title: MediaComposition#getMainBlockReason
list.description: Block reason for main chapter. This also uses current date for STARTDATE.

list.title: MediaComposition#getMainBlockedSegments
list.description: Get blocked segments from the main chapter.

list.title: MediaComposition#getMainChapter
list.description: Get the mediaComposition's main chapter.

list.title: MediaComposition#getMainChapterImageUrl
list.description: Get the main chapter's image URL decorated with default width and format.

list.title: MediaComposition#getMainResources
list.description: Get main resources.

list.title: MediaComposition#getMainSegments
list.description: Get segments of the main chapter ordered by markIn.

list.title: MediaComposition#getMainTimeIntervals
list.description: Retrieves an array of time intervals associated with the main chapter.

list.title: MediaComposition#getMainValidFromDate
list.description: Compute a date from which this content is valid. Always return a date object.

list.title: MediaComposition#getMergedAnalyticsData
list.description: Get merged analytics data.

list.title: MediaComposition#getMergedAnalyticsMetadata
list.description: Get merged analytics metadata.

list.title: MediaComposition#getResourceList
list.description: Get the chapter's resource list

list.title: MediaInfo
list.description: The media information.

list.title: MetadataInfo
list.description: Get metadata information from the performance API for a given id.

list.title: PillarboxMonitoring
list.description: Creates an instance of PillarboxMonitoring.

list.title: PillarboxMonitoring#addListeners
list.description: Adds event listeners to the player and the window.

list.title: PillarboxMonitoring#bandwidth
list.description: The current bandwidth of the last segment download.

list.title: PillarboxMonitoring#bindCallBacks
list.description: Binds the callback functions to the current instance.

list.title: PillarboxMonitoring#bufferDuration
list.description: Get the buffer duration in milliseconds.

list.title: PillarboxMonitoring#currentAudioTrack
list.description: Gets the language of the current audio track.

list.title: PillarboxMonitoring#currentSourceMediaData
list.description: The media data of the current source.

list.title: PillarboxMonitoring#currentTextTrack
list.description: Gets the language of the current text track (subtitles or captions).

list.title: PillarboxMonitoring#error
list.description: Handles player errors by sending an ERROR event, then resets the session.

list.title: PillarboxMonitoring#getDrmRequestDuration
list.description: Get the DRM license request duration from performance API.

list.title: PillarboxMonitoring#getTokenRequestDuration
list.description: Get the Akamai token request duration from performance API.

list.title: PillarboxMonitoring#heartbeat
list.description: Send an 'HEARTBEAT' event with the date of the current playback state at regular intervals.

list.title: PillarboxMonitoring#isTrackerDisabled
list.description: Check if the tracker is disabled.

list.title: PillarboxMonitoring#loadStart
list.description: Handles loadstart event and captures the current timestamp. Will be used to calculate the media loading time.

list.title: PillarboxMonitoring#loadedData
list.description: Handles the session start by sending a START event immediately followed by a HEARTBEAT when the loadeddata event is triggered.

list.title: PillarboxMonitoring#playbackDuration
list.description: The total playback duration for the current session.

list.title: PillarboxMonitoring#playbackStart
list.description: Assign the timestamp each time the playback starts.

list.title: PillarboxMonitoring#playbackStop
list.description: Calculates and accumulates the duration of the playback session each time the playback stops for the current media.

list.title: PillarboxMonitoring#removeListeners
list.description: Removes all event listeners from the player and the window.

list.title: PillarboxMonitoring#removeTokenFromAssetUrl
list.description: Remove the token from the asset URL.

list.title: PillarboxMonitoring#reset
list.description: Resets the playback session and clears relevant properties.

list.title: PillarboxMonitoring#sendEvent
list.description: Sends an event to the server using the Beacon API.

list.title: PillarboxMonitoring#sessionStart
list.description: Starts a new session by first stopping the previous session, then resetting the session start timestamp and media ID to their new values.

list.title: PillarboxMonitoring#sessionStop
list.description: Stops the current session by sending a STOP event and resetting the session.

list.title: PillarboxMonitoring#stalled
list.description: Handles the stalled state of the player. Sets the stalled state and listens for the event that indicates the player is no longer stalled.

list.title: PillarboxMonitoring.deviceId
list.description: Retrieve or generate a unique device ID and stores it in localStorage.

list.title: PillarboxMonitoring.errorKeyCode
list.description:
Returns a string representing the error key combined with its error code.

If the error code doesn't exist the error key undefined.

list.title: PillarboxMonitoring.randomUUID
list.description: Generate a cryptographically secure random UUID.

list.title: PillarboxMonitoring.secondsToMilliseconds
list.description: converts seconds into milliseconds.

list.title: PillarboxMonitoring.sessionId
list.description: Generates a new session ID.

list.title: PillarboxMonitoring.timestamp
list.description: The timestamp in milliseconds.

list.title: PillarboxMonitoring.userAgent
list.description: The browser's user agent.

list.title: PillarboxMonitoringOptions
list.description: Pillarbox Monitoring configuration options.

list.title: PlaybackPosition
list.description: The current playback position and position timestamp.

list.title: Player
list.description: This class extends the video.js Player.

list.title: Player#audioTrack
list.description: A getter/setter for the media's audio track. Activates the audio track according to the language and kind properties. Falls back on the first audio track found if the kind property is not satisfied.

list.title: Player#bufferedRanges
list.description: Calculates an array of ranges based on the buffered() data.

list.title: Player#playedPercent
list.description:
Get the percent (as a decimal) of the media that's been played. This method is not a part of the native HTML video API.

Live streams with DVR are not currently supported.

list.title: Player#playedRanges
list.description: Get an array of ranges based on the played data.

list.title: Player#seekableRanges
list.description: Calculates an array of ranges based on the seekable() data.

list.title: Player#textTrack
list.description: A getter/setter for the media's text track. Activates the text track according to the language and kind properties. Falls back on the first text track found if the kind property is not satisfied. Disables all subtitle tracks that are showing if the trackSelector is truthy but does not satisfy any condition.

list.title: PlayerCurrentDimensions
list.description: The current dimensions of the player.

list.title: PlayerInfo
list.description: Information about the player.

list.title: PlayerProperty
list.description: Represents a player property associated with a media segment.

list.title: PresentationType
list.description: Presentation format

list.title: Presenter
list.description: Represents a presenter.

list.title: Program
list.description: Represents a program.

list.title: QoeTimings
list.description: Generates the QoE timings object.

list.title: QosTimings
list.description: Generates the QoS timings object.

list.title: QualityType
list.description: Content quality

list.title: RelatedContent
list.description: Represents related content associated with a media segment.

list.title: Representation
list.description: Get the current representation when playing a Dash or Hls media.

list.title: Resource
list.description: Represents a resource associated with a media segment.

list.title: Resource
list.description: Get the current resource information including bitrate and URL when available.

list.title: SRGAnalytics
list.description: Creates an instance of SRGAnalytics.

list.title: SRGAnalytics#beforeunload
list.description: Sent when the window, the document and its resources are about to be unloaded.

list.title: SRGAnalytics#clearTimers
list.description: Clear timers used to send uptime and heartbeat.

list.title: SRGAnalytics#currentTime
list.description: Get the tracked current time in seconds.

list.title: SRGAnalytics#debug
list.description: Get or set debug mode.

list.title: SRGAnalytics#destroy
list.description: Destroy all properties and setIntervals to avoid mixing media sessions.

list.title: SRGAnalytics#dispose
list.description:
Dispose all listeners used to send analytics data to TagCommander.

Calls beforeunload to send a notify stop. Clear intervals and timeouts.

Used events

  • beforeunload
  • emptied
  • ended
  • loadstart
  • loadeddata
  • play
  • pause
  • timeupdate

list.title: SRGAnalytics#emptied
list.description:
Sent before a new media is loading.

  • Destroy all properties.
  • Send a notify stop if the media is not ended and new media is about to be loaded.

list.title: SRGAnalytics#ended
list.description: Sent when playback completes.

list.title: SRGAnalytics#flush
list.description: Flush the queued events when tc event script is loaded.

list.title: SRGAnalytics#getCurrentAudioTrack
list.description: Get the language of the current audio track.

list.title: SRGAnalytics#getCurrentTextTrack
list.description: Get the language of the current text track.

list.title: SRGAnalytics#getDvrWindowPosition
list.description: Get the position inside the dvr window where the 0 represents the live edge

list.title: SRGAnalytics#getDvrWindowSize
list.description: Get the size of the live DVR window in milliseconds.

list.title: SRGAnalytics#getElapsedPlaybackTime
list.description: Get the elapsed playback time in seconds.

list.title: SRGAnalytics#getElapsedPlayingTime
list.description: Get the elapsed playing time in seconds.

list.title: SRGAnalytics#getEventLabels
list.description: Set all event labels to be sent to TagCommander. The event labels are updated whenever a new event occurs.

list.title: SRGAnalytics#getInternalLabels
list.description: Set all internal labels to be sent to TagCommander. Internal labels are assigned once at initialisation time.

list.title: SRGAnalytics#heartBeat
list.description:
The action pos should be sent regularly every 30 seconds. It is used for tracking the viewed chapters of a video and the last position of the video, in case the user ends the video by closing the browser tab/window.

  • pos should be sent when the media player is in "play mode".
  • once the video is paused or stopped, the timer for sending these actions must be stopped.

list.title: SRGAnalytics#initCallbacks
list.description:
Initialize callbacks used to send analytics data to TagCommander.

Used events

  • beforeunload
  • emptied
  • ended
  • loadstart
  • loadeddata
  • play
  • pause
  • ratechange
  • seeking
  • timeupdate
  • waiting

list.title: SRGAnalytics#initListeners
list.description:
Initialize all listeners used to send analytics data to TagCommander.

Used events

  • beforeunload
  • dispose
  • emptied
  • ended
  • loadstart
  • loadeddata
  • play
  • pause
  • timeupdate
  • waiting

list.title: SRGAnalytics#initScript
list.description: Initialize TagCommander script dynamically and add it to the DOM

list.title: SRGAnalytics#isAudioDescriptionEnabled
list.description: Check if the audio description track is enabled.

list.title: SRGAnalytics#isAudioTrackEnabled
list.description: Check if the audio track is enabled.

list.title: SRGAnalytics#isMediaDvr
list.description: Check if the media is a live with DVR.

list.title: SRGAnalytics#isMediaLive
list.description: Check if the media is a live.

list.title: SRGAnalytics#isMediaOnDemand
list.description: Check if the media is an on demand.

list.title: SRGAnalytics#isTextTrackEnabled
list.description: Check if the text track is enabled.

list.title: SRGAnalytics#isTrackerDisabled
list.description: Check if the tracker is disabled.

list.title: SRGAnalytics#loadeddata
list.description: The first frame of the media has finished loading.

list.title: SRGAnalytics#loadstart
list.description: Sent when loading of the media begins.

list.title: SRGAnalytics#log
list.description: Event logger that prints the current event, event labels and internal labels in the browser's console.

list.title: SRGAnalytics#notify
list.description: Notify TagCommander all event and internal labels. If tc script is not available it queues all pending events.

list.title: SRGAnalytics#pause
list.description:
Sent when the playback state is changed to paused (paused property is true). Pause event is sent if :

  • The player is not scrubbing
  • The stream is not a live only
  • The current time is strictly inferior to the duration

list.title: SRGAnalytics#play
list.description: Sent when the playback state is no longer paused, as a result of the play method, or the autoplay attribute.

list.title: SRGAnalytics#rateChange
list.description: Sent to ComScore when the playback rate changes.

list.title: SRGAnalytics#reloadTagCommanderContainer
list.description: Reload the tagCommander container and set all ComScore labels

list.title: SRGAnalytics#seeking
list.description: Sent when the current time is modified by the player's currentTime API.

list.title: SRGAnalytics#timeShifted
list.description: Gets the number of seconds that separate from the live edge that is represented by 0.

list.title: SRGAnalytics#timeUpdate
list.description: Track current time updates delayed by a tick.

list.title: SRGAnalytics#updateSrcMediaData
list.description: Update the src media data.

list.title: SRGAnalytics#uptime
list.description:
Calculate the uptime when playing a live stream with or without DVR

Rules:

  • Send the first uptime after 30 seconds
  • Send uptime each 60 seconds after the 30 seconds
  • Uptime is sent only when playing

list.title: SRGAnalytics#waiting
list.description: ComScore: It's expected notifyBufferStart() to be called when the player starts buffering and a call to notifyBufferStop() when content resumes after buffering.

list.title: SRGAnalytics.now
list.description: Return the current timestamp in seconds.

list.title: SRGAnalyticsOptions
list.description: SRG Analytics configuration options.

list.title: ScheduledBroadcast
list.description: Represents a scheduled broadcast.

list.title: Segment
list.description: Represents a media segment with detailed metadata.

list.title: Show
list.description: Represents a show.

list.title: SocialCountEntry
list.description: Represents a social media count entry associated with a media segment.

list.title: SpriteSheet
list.description: Represents a sprite sheet associated with a chapter.

list.title: SrgOptions
list.description:
Represents a set of options specific to the SRG SSR.

Note:

  • All these options have a default value and can therefore be undefined.
  • DataProvider options cannot be combined with each other.

list.title: SrgSsr.addBlockedSegments
list.description: Adds blocked segments to the player.

list.title: SrgSsr.addChapters
list.description: Adds chapters to the player.

list.title: SrgSsr.addIntervals
list.description: Adds intervals to the player.

list.title: SrgSsr.addRemoteTextTracks
list.description: Adds remote text tracks from an array of subtitles.

list.title: SrgSsr.addTextTrackCue
list.description: Add a new cue to a text track with the given data.

list.title: SrgSsr.addTextTracks
list.description: Add multiple text tracks to the player.

list.title: SrgSsr.blockingReason
list.description: Set a blocking reason according to the block reason returned by mediaData.

list.title: SrgSsr.composeAkamaiResources
list.description: Add the Akamai token to all resources if at least one of them has tokenType set to Akamai.

list.title: SrgSsr.composeKeySystemsResources
list.description: Add the keySystems property to all resources if at least one of them has DRM.

list.title: SrgSsr.composeMainResources
list.description: Get the main resources from a mediaComposition. May add an Akamai token or key systems if required by the resource.

list.title: SrgSsr.composeSrcMediaData
list.description: Compose source options with media data. MediaData properties from source options overwrite mediaData from IL.

list.title: SrgSsr.createTextTrack
list.description: Create a new metadata text track.

list.title: SrgSsr.cuechangeEventProxy
list.description: Proxy SRG SSR chapters and intervals cuechange events at player level.

list.title: SrgSsr.dataProvider
list.description: SRG SSR data provider singleton.

list.title: SrgSsr.dataProviderError
list.description: Set an error if something goes wrong with the data provider.

list.title: SrgSsr.error
list.description: Set player error.

list.title: SrgSsr.filterIncompatibleResources
list.description: Filter out incompatible resources such as RTMP and HDS.

list.title: SrgSsr.getBlockedSegment
list.description: Get the current blocked segment from the player.

list.title: SrgSsr.getBlockedSegmentByTime
list.description: Get the VTT cue of a blocked segment.

list.title: SrgSsr.getMediaComposition
list.description: Get mediaComposition from an URN.

list.title: SrgSsr.getMediaData
list.description: Get the mediaData most likely to be compatible depending on the browser.

list.title: SrgSsr.getSrcMediaObj
list.description: Get the source media object.

list.title: SrgSsr.handleCurrentTime
list.description:
Handles the middleware's currentTime function.

  • If the current time is between the start and end of a blocked segment, the blocked portion will be skipped.

Note: This function should disappear as soon as this behavior is supported on the packaging side.

list.title: SrgSsr.handleSetCurrentTime
list.description:
Handles the middleware's setCurrentTime function.

  • Modify the current time if the value is between the start and end of a blocked segment.

Note: This function should disappear as soon as this behavior is supported on the packaging side.

list.title: SrgSsr.handleSetSource
list.description:
Handles the middleware's setSource function.

This function allows to:

  • resolve a URN into media that can be played by the player
  • initialize media playback tracking
  • update the title bar
  • handle blocking reasons
  • add remote subtitles

list.title: SrgSsr.middleware
list.description: Middleware to resolve SRG SSR URNs into playable media.

list.title: SrgSsr.pillarboxMonitoring
list.description: PillarboxMonitoring monitoring singleton.

list.title: SrgSsr.srgAnalytics
list.description: SRG SSR analytics singleton.

list.title: SrgSsr.updatePoster
list.description: Update player's poster.

list.title: SrgSsr.updateTitleBar
list.description: Update player titleBar with title and description.

list.title: StallInfo
list.description: Information about the player's stall events.

list.title: StartEventData
list.description: Generates the data for the start event.

list.title: StatusEventData
list.description: Get data on the current playback state. Will be used when sending HEARTBEAT or STOP events.

list.title: StreamingType
list.description: Enumerates various streaming methods

list.title: SubTopic
list.description: Represents a subtopic.

list.title: Subtitle
list.description: Represents subtitle information for a media segment.

list.title: SubtitleInformation
list.description: Represents subtitle information associated with a media resource.

list.title: TimeInterval
list.description: Represents a time interval metadata used to mark the beginning and ending of opening or closing credits.

list.title: TokenType
list.description: Represents different token types for authentication

list.title: Topic
list.description: Represents a topic.

list.title: TrackSelector
list.description: The track to select

list.title: TrackSourceType
list.description: Source type for audio/video tracks

list.title: TransmissionType
list.description: Medium of transmission

list.title: VendorType
list.description: Broadcasting organizations

list.title: pillarbox
list.description: Pillarbox is an alias for the video.js namespace with additional options.

list.title: pillarbox.options.enableSmoothSeeking
list.description: Enable smooth seeking for Pillarbox.

list.title: pillarbox.options.fill
list.description: Enable fill mode for the video player, allowing it to expand to fill the container.

list.title: pillarbox.options.html5
list.description: Configuration options for HTML5 settings in Pillarbox.

list.title: pillarbox.options.liveTracker
list.description: Configuration for the live tracker.

list.title: pillarbox.options.liveui
list.description:
Allows the player to use the live ui that includes:

  • A progress bar for seeking within the live window
  • A button that can be clicked to seek to the live edge with a circle indicating if you are at the live edge or not.

list.title: pillarbox.options.playsinline
list.description: Indicates that the video is to be played "inline", that is within the element's playback area.

list.title: pillarbox.options.responsive
list.description: Enable responsive mode, this will cause the player to customize itself based on responsive breakpoints.

list.title: pillarbox.options.trackers
list.description: A placeholder for accessing trackers directly from the player.
